oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Sword
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Handmade Tennessee Dog River sword (Confederate) has an unstopped blade, brass hilt, and oilskin grip bound with wire. Belonged to John Knox Womack, Co. D, 8th Tenn. Cav. Regt. Born in 1844, he was ordained a Freewill Baptist minister around 1869 and died in 1922. The J. K. Womack Papers are held at the University of Tennessee Libraries, Special Collections.
